headline.main: MUNICIPAL REFORM.; GREAT MASS MEETING. Six Thousand Citizens in Metropolitan Hall. NEW MEN FOR THE NEW CHARTER. THE COMING ELECTION. ADDRESS TO THE ELECTORS. Speeches by Hon. Peter Cooper, Judge Vanderpool, Wm. A. Dodge, H Greeley and others.

docs.lead_paragraph: A very large and enthusiastic meeting of the friends of City Reform was held last evening, at Metropolitan Hall. The movement which was inaugurated in the same place in March last, has since gone actively forward, and the gathering of last night was a further exhibition of the determination of our citizens to establish a thorough reform in the municipal affairs of the City.

headline.main: THE THOMPSON WILL CASE.; The last Will and Testament of Abraham G. Thompson. ARGUMENT OF COUNSEL CONTINUED.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before A. W. Bradford, Esq, Surragate. In the TIMES of Friday last we stated the general facts of this interesting case, now pending before A. W BRADFORD, Esq., Surrogate. DANIEL LORD, Esq., ??gued it on behalf of those who assert the validity of the Will. In his opening speech, which, owing to the accidental absence of our reporter, has not been given in our columns. Mr. LORD, referring to the testamentary capacity of Mr. THOMPSON,
